titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the David Dean Barrett Papers, 1933-1970
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 1 manuscript box, 4 envelopes, 1 album box, 2 phonorecords, memorabilia.

did.abstract: Manuscripts of writings, correspondence, printed matter, photographs, and phonorecords, relating to the Dixie Mission and the military situation in China during World War II. Includes a coat worn in China by Colonel Barrett.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], David Dean Barrett Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Colonel, U.S. Army; chief of the U.S. Dixie Mission to Chinese communist forces, 1944.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Manuscripts of writings, correspondence, printed matter, photographs, and phonorecords, relating to the Dixie Mission and the military situation in China during World War II. Includes a coat worn in China by Colonel Barrett.

did.unittitle: Biographical information. Article on David D. Barrett, San Francisco Chronicle, 1970 December 13
Letter, Lancelot Giles to David D. Barrett, 1933 November 2, regarding the Boxer Rebellion and a particular incident. Typescript
Letter, David D. Barrett to Dr. Currie, 1941 February 12, regarding the military and economic situation in China, as well as communist activities. Typescript
Letter, Nelson T. Johnson to David D. Barrett, 1944 April 29, regarding the situation in China (Chiang, Japanese, etc.). Typescript
Letter, John P. Welch to General Gibbins, 1937 August 24, regarding Peiping and Tientsin (China)
Instructions to Col. Barrett from the U.S. Army. Forces in China Theater, regarding the mission of intelligence detachment sent into the area under control of the Chinese communists. Typescript

Manuscript entitled "The Dixie Mission" regarding a U.S. Army Observer Group that was sent from the China-Burma-India Theater Headquarters, in Chungking, to establish liaison with the Chinese Communists in Yenan, Shensi Province, then headquarters of the Chinese Communists, 1944 (110 pages)
Cartoons (positive photostats) of "American Spy Activities" drawn by Miao-ti and Chao Chin-fang, relating to Col. Barrett's spy activities. Published in Peiping newspapers in August or September 1951
Copy of article "A U.S. Spy Ring in New China" by Adam Lapin, Our World, 1961 October 5
22 prints plus 8 duplicates depicting activities of the U.S. Army Observer Group in Yenan, China,
1 photo of Armed Services attaches and officers of the Foreign Legation Guards. Peking,
Photograph albums and parts of albums, primarily in China and Taiwan,

1 print of David Barrett; 11 prints of David Barrett and others; 2 prints of General Douglas MacArthur; 1 print of President and Mme. Chiang Kai-Shek; 1 print of Pres, Chiang Kai-shek; 8 unidentified prints,
